info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 23 at 2:28PM EDT until July 23 at 2:45PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM EDT FOR EASTERN COLUMBIANA...BEAVER...SOUTHERN LAWRENCE...SOUTHWESTERN BUTLER...NORTHWESTERN ALLEGHENY AND HANCOCK COUNTIES... At 227 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Industry, or near Monaca, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Cranberry, Moon Township, New Castle, Franklin Park, East Liverpool, Aliquippa, Beaver Falls, Columbiana, Monaca, East Palestine, Economy, and Ellwood City. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
